intro: Roubieva botrys, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of blue and purple. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Roubieva botrys is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in gardens.
